previous.name: Ten on Liable to Be Reborn, Etc.

segments.en: Linked Discourses 35
5. All is Impermanent
43–51. Nine on Impermanence, Etc.
At Sāvatthī.
“Mendicants, all is impermanent.
And what is the all that is impermanent?

segments.pli: Cakkhu, bhikkhave, aniccaṃ, rūpā aniccā, cakkhuviññāṇaṃ aniccaṃ, cakkhusamphasso anicco.
segments.en: The eye, sights, eye consciousness, and eye contact are impermanent.

segments.pli: Yampidaṃ cakkhusamphassapaccayā uppajjati vedayitaṃ sukhaṃ vā dukkhaṃ vā adukkhamasukhaṃ vā tampi aniccaṃ … pe …
segments.en: And the pleasant, painful, or neutral feeling that arises conditioned by eye contact is also impermanent.

segments.pli: jivhā aniccā, rasā aniccā, jivhāviññāṇaṃ aniccaṃ, jivhāsamphasso anicco.
segments.en: The ear … nose … tongue …

segments.pli: Yampidaṃ jivhāsamphassapaccayā uppajjati vedayitaṃ sukhaṃ vā dukkhaṃ vā adukkhamasukhaṃ vā tampi aniccaṃ.

segments.en: body …

segments.pli: mano anicco, dhammā aniccā, manoviññāṇaṃ aniccaṃ, manosamphasso anicco.
segments.en: The mind, thoughts, mind consciousness, and mind contact are impermanent.

segments.pli: Yampidaṃ manosamphassapaccayā uppajjati vedayitaṃ sukhaṃ vā dukkhaṃ vā adukkhamasukhaṃ vā tampi aniccaṃ.
segments.en: The painful, pleasant, or neutral feeling that arises conditioned by mind contact is also impermanent.

segments.pli: Evaṃ passaṃ, bhikkhave, sutavā ariyasāvako cakkhusmimpi nibbindati, rūpesupi nibbindati, cakkhuviññāṇepi nibbindati, cakkhusamphassepi nibbindati.
segments.en: Seeing this, a learned noble disciple grows disillusioned …

segments.pli: Yampidaṃ cakkhusamphassapaccayā uppajjati vedayitaṃ sukhaṃ vā dukkhaṃ vā adukkhamasukhaṃ vā tasmimpi nibbindati … pe …
manasmimpi nibbindati, dhammesupi nibbindati, manoviññāṇepi nibbindati, manosamphassepi nibbindati,
yampidaṃ manosamphassapaccayā uppajjati vedayitaṃ sukhaṃ vā dukkhaṃ vā adukkhamasukhaṃ vā tasmimpi nibbindati.
Nibbindaṃ virajjati; virāgā vimuccati; vimuttasmiṃ vimuttamiti ñāṇaṃ hoti.
‘Khīṇā jāti, vusitaṃ brahmacariyaṃ, kataṃ karaṇīyaṃ, nāparaṃ itthattāyā’ti pajānātī”ti.
segments.en: They understand: ‘Rebirth is ended, the spiritual journey has been completed, what had to be done has been done, there is no return to any state of existence.’”
“Mendicants, all is suffering. …”
“Mendicants, all is not-self. …”
“Mendicants, all is to be directly known. …”
“Mendicants, all is to be completely understood. …”
“Mendicants, all is to be given up. …”
“Mendicants, all is to be realized. …”
“Mendicants, all is to be directly known and completely understood. …”
“Mendicants, all is troubled. …”

suttaplex.blurb: The “all” consisting of the six interior and exterior sense fields is impermanent, etc.
